headline: Paramount Skydance Is Buying The Free Press for $150 Million. What It Means for CBS.
summary: Paramount Skydance  is acquiring The Free Press, the media company founded by journalist Bari Weiss, and making Weiss editor in chief of CBS News, the companies said Monday.  Paramount is paying $150 million in the cash-and-stock deal, The Wall Street Journal reported, citing a person familiar with the agreement.  The Free Press “will remain independent,” Weiss wrote in an open letter to the site’s 1.5 million subscribers.
